intro: Hordeum praecox, commonly known as early barley, is a species of grass native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is an annual plant that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with numerous颖花, which contain the grains. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a fibrous root system. Hordeum praecox is often used as a forage crop and has historical significance in human agriculture.
